%c[0,250,250,250]Azazel mode%c[0,170,170,170] allows you to continue playing as another character after death.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Information%c[0,170,170,170] 
In Azazel mode death is not the end - upon the demise of your character you will posses the body of a random stalker who was previously controlled by the AI.
 
Should you have companions at the time of your death, they will be given priority and you will continue playing as one of them instead.
 
This mode can only be enabled from the character creation screen.

%c[0,250,250,250]Ironman mode%c[0,170,170,170] adds an indirect layer of difficulty to gameplay, whereby all of your saved games for a character are deleted upon their death.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Information%c[0,170,170,170] 
Should Azazel mode be enabled at the same time you will be allowed to continue playing as whoever you switched to, but saves made as your deceased character will be deleted as per usual.
 
When playing with this mode enabled all of the saves you make will be uniquely tagged as an ironman by the way, as such it is impossible for unrelated saves to be deleted by mistake.
 
This mode can only be enabled from the character creation screen.

%c[0,250,250,250]Story mode%c[0,170,170,170] enables a non-linear story based on the events of S.T.A.L.K.E.R. Shadow of Chernobyl.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Information%c[0,170,170,170] 
With this mode enabled you start the game with the 'Mysteries of the Zone' storyline, and the tasks of disabling both the Brain Scorcher and the Miracle Machine.
 
To begin the story you will need to find an important individual hiding somewhere within the Zone, who after a brief dialogue will provide you with multiple tasks which can be completed in any order.
 
This mode can only be enabled from the character creation screen.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Availability%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Clear Sky
• Duty
• Ecologist
• Freedom
• Loner
• Mercenary

%c[0,250,250,250]Survival mode%c[0,170,170,170] turns the Zone into a hunting ground - where you are the prey.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Information%c[0,170,170,170] 
With this mode enabled all spawns are replaced with zombified stalkers and mutants, who will slowly stumble towards your location in an attempt to kill you.
 
Featuring a more prominent role are zombies themselves, the last devolution of zombified stalkers who have lost the ability to operate mechanical devices such as firearms.
 
Only a few traders and stalker squads can be found, meaning you will have to survive off of what you can scavenge in the world.
 
This mode can only be enabled from the character creation screen.

%c[0,250,250,250]Campfire save mode%c[0,170,170,170] prevents you from saving your progress the usual way. You can only save on nearby campfires.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Information%c[0,170,170,170] 
To save your progress on a nearby campfire, you need a %c[0,250,250,250]Firestarter set%c[0,170,170,170] or a %c[0,250,250,250]Box of matches%c[0,170,170,170] 
Approach a nearby campfire until you see a message appearing on the HUD about it, then use one of the mentioned items to save your progress. 
You can save your progress normally without campfires in underground levels.

%c[0,250,250,250]Agony mode%c[0,170,170,170] adds another layer of difficulty by preventing you from saving your progress if some critical conditions are met.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Information%c[0,170,170,170] 
%c[0,56,209,115] You can't save your progress in Agony mode if you're: 
%c[200,200,200,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]Injured 
%c[200,200,200,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]Bleeding 
%c[200,200,200,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]Irradiated 
%c[200,200,200,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]In combat with enemies 
%c[200,200,200,50]• %c[0,150,150,150]Under circumstances of an emission or psi-storm
%c[0,250,250,250]In Timer mode%c[0,170,170,170], you can save your game every specific amount of time. \nOnce you save your game, you cannot make another save once again until the timer is over.

%c[0,250,250,250]Companions%c[0,170,170,170] are stalkers who can be recruited to your side, similar to followers and familiars in other games.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Information%c[0,170,170,170] 
With the Zone being as dangerous as it is, most other stalkers can be found exploring in small groups, usually in size of around 3 to 4 individuals.
 
This feature allows you to do the same, as by talking to the leader of one of these groups you may be able to convince them to explore the Zone together with you.
 
The only requirements are that the squad's leader must have friendly relations with you, that his rank be no more than a single tier above yours, and that you haven't too many stalkers already following you.
 
In very special cases, characters such as Fanatic may be used as companions to help complete certain tasks, having their own unique set of requirements, and not counting towards your squad limit.
 
Information about your companions can be viewed in the Relations tab of the PDA, where you can also issue them orders as a group or individually, as well as change their behaviours.
 
This can also be done through key bindings, which can be set via the Controls options menu.

The %c[0,250,250,250]Guide%c[0,170,170,170] is a resource to help teach you about the game and its contents.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Information%c[0,170,170,170] 
This feature was added at much request by players to help explain features and gameplay mechanics, as well as to add a more visual representation of your progression.
 
Articles are sorted by category, with all tutorial-esque and important content being unlocked right from creating your own character.
 
When you unlock an article its name and category are displayed in the message, allowing you to find the content with relative ease.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Disclaimer%c[0,170,170,170] 
For the first time since S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl a serious attempt is being made at reintroducing a complete in-game user guide to all available content.
 
Although this feature is mostly complete in function it is still in an early work-in-progress stage, and as such only a small percentage of articles have been written.
 
Because of the magnitude of such a task there is much more yet to be added, with many missing and incomplete categories, and the interactive unlock system not yet being fully integrated.
 
By introducing new articles with further updates and patches the guide will eventually be completed but it will take quite some time.

The %c[0,250,250,250]HUD%c[0,170,170,170] shows you indicators regarding various important states regarding your health and equipment.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Information%c[0,170,170,170] 
%c[0,250,250,250]State%c[0,170,170,170] indicators represent the current negative state of your health and equipment. A gray indicator is shown if the related state is slightly bad, while yellow is concerning. Orange and red determine critical states. 
%c[0,250,250,250]Danger%c[0,170,170,170] indicators are shown when you enter a dangerous zone, which have a direct effect on your health or equipment. The worse the color, the more damage you constantly get. 
%c[0,250,250,250]Boosting%c[0,170,170,170] indicators are shown as long as you're under effects of a booster item. They are either protection or healing indicators. Once the effects of the used item fade away, the related indicators will disappear afterwards.

%c[0,250,250,250]Map spots%c[0,170,170,170] are icons which appear on the map to highlight points of particular interest.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Information%c[0,170,170,170] 
Many locations and entities have map spots associated with them, making it easier to read the map at a glance without having to worry about remembering tons of information.
 
You are able to create your own custom map spots by double-clicking on the map and entering a name to be displayed when hovered over - these can be renamed or removed later by right-clicking them and selecting the appropriate context option.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Toggles%c[0,170,170,170] 
Anomalous areas, important objects (traders, technicians, beds, etc.), stashes, and task waypoints can be toggled within the PDA by pressing the aptly named buttons at the top of the map tab.
 
Regardless of these settings, those which are attributed to stalkers and other moving objects are always visible on your minimap - as there is no guarantee they will remain stationary and in a single location.

%c[0,250,250,250]Rank%c[0,170,170,170] is a score system based on what a stalker has accomplished in the Zone.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Information%c[0,170,170,170] 
Actions which you perform throughout your playthrough are recorded and each grant a varying number of points depending on the action in question.
 
As you accumulate more and more points your rank will gradually change as you pass through every milestone, with each requiring an additional 1,000 points on top of the requirements of its predecessor.
 
Most of these actions are logged in the statistics tab of the PDA, which also contains an in-game leaderboard that keeps track of the current top-100 highest ranking stalkers.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Ranks%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Rookie: 0
• Trainee: 1,000
• Experienced: 3,000
• Professional: 6,000
• Veteran: 10,000
• Expert: 15,000
• Master: 21,000
• Legend: 28,000

%c[0,250,250,250]Reputation%c[0,170,170,170] is a representation of how a stalker interacts with others.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Information%c[0,170,170,170] 
Reputation is similar to rank but differs in that it isn't quite so linear - being able to both increase and decrease - and that it is based on your interactions with other stalkers rather than the environment.
 
The easiest ways to increase reputation are by completing tasks, providing first-aid, and killing your faction's enemies, whilst inversely the easiest ways to lose it are by cancelling or failing tasks, and killing neutral or friendly stalkers.
 
It should be noted that whilst it is used by some features, reputation is largely immersion-focused and should not be confused with goodwill.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Reputations%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Terrible: -2,000
• Dreary: -1,500
• Awful: -1,000
• Bad: -500
• Neutral: 0
• Good: 500
• Great: 1,000
• Brilliant: 1,500
• Excellent: 2,000

%c[0,250,250,250]Stashes%c[0,170,170,170] are items stored by stalkers in often well-hidden locations.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Information%c[0,170,170,170] 
Most stalkers in the Zone store spare ammunition, food, and medicines in containers, backpacks, and other hidden objects with the intent to retrieve them later.
 
Frequently the information as to their whereabouts dies with the stalker who hid them, resulting in numerous stashes full of unused items strewing the landscape waiting to be discovered at any time.
 
Information brokers and traders often give coordinates to stashes as a bonus payment for those who have done good work for them, whereas those in a tight pinch might try to use their own personal stashes to barter for their survival.
 
You can create your own stashes by right-clicking and selecting the appropriate option on any backpack in your inventory.
 
Stashes which you create are never looted by other stalkers, so your items will always be safe.
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Identification%c[0,170,170,170] 
The type and/or status of a stash can be easily determined by looking at its icon on the map or by hovering your mouse cursor over it.
 
• Green: Untouched
• Purple: Partially looted
• Yellow: Player-owned
• Red: Unique

%c[0,250,250,250]Advanced Weapon Repair (AWR)%c[0,170,170,170] allows the player to repair his/her weapon at a mechanic's workshop\vice. 
 
%c[0,56,209,115]Information%c[0,170,170,170] 
Instead of paying mechanics to repair your weapons, you can use their vices to do the repair yourself as long as you have the required gears. 
The repair procedure is affected by the overall quality of the weapon (new, worn, rusty) and its current condition. Moreover, the terms 0-65, 0-75 and 0-85 determine the weapon status for each of the quality types: 
• 0-65% for rusty weapons. 
• 0-75% for worn weapons. 
• 0-85% for new weapons. 
 
%c[0,56,166,209]Required items and toolsc%c[0,170,170,170] 
• Replacement parts (should be suitable for your weapons. You can get them by disassembling similar weapon types using the %c[0,250,250,250]Multitool%c[0,170,170,170]) 
• Weapon repair kit 
• Weapon modification kits 
 
%c[0,56,166,209]Repair and upgrade procedurec%c[0,170,170,170] 
Replacing parts when repairing weapons with a low state occurs in a certain sequence: 
• At condition 0-20/0-25/0-30% - Replacement of barrel 
• At condition 20-35/25-45/30-55% - Replacement of trigger (shock-trigger mechanism) 
• At condition 35-45/45-60/55-70% - Replacement of breech head 
• At condition 45-55/60-70/70-80% - Replacement of gas tube 
• At condition 55-65/70-75/80-85% - Replacement of breech block 
 
%c[0,209,209,56]Steps:%c[0,170,170,170] 
1• Disassemble your weapon at a mechanic's vice. 
2• Select a %c[0,250,250,250]weapon repair kit%c[0,170,170,170] to replace the weapon barrel with another barrel of the same caliber, this can be also done by using a %c[0,250,250,250]weapon upgrade kit%c[0,170,170,170] in a condition from 20-65%/25-75%/30-85%. Double click on the kit to apply the repair procedure. 
3• Select a %c[0,250,250,250]Weapon modification kit%c[0,170,170,170] to replace the rest of parts in the list. 
4• Click on the image of the part that is being currently replaced (the part selected for the replacement that is available for replacement is indicated by a green light). Attempting to replace one part spends one charge of the %c[0,250,250,250]Weapon modification kit%c[0,170,170,170] (keep in mind that a modification kit can be used 3 times) 
5• In case the replacement is successful, this procedure is repeated for all parts in the specified order 
6• In case the part has been damaged, try again if there is a repair kit and any more weapon parts. 
7• All replaced parts are retained until the condition of the weapon is lowered. In this case, to improve the quality, the parts will need to be replaced anew. 
8• When all five parts have been replaced, the quality of the weapon will be changed to the corresponding one. On that note, if at least one of the replaced items has been worn out, the quality of the weapon will be changed to "worn", even if other weapon parts are replaced with new ones.
